page.title: 01Chew Magna and Environs
page.content: Nominated as the best kept large village of 1984 in Avon,Chew Magna,six miles south of Bristol,has a church dating from Norman times with a cross in the churchyard. Near St. Andrew's Church is Chew Court and also the Old Schoolroom,an historic building some 500 years old. At the other end of the High Street is the Manor House,nowadays the Sacred Heart Convent and architecturally of interest.Other attractive buildings line the High Street,some still in use as family dwellings or converted to retail premises. High pavements are an unusual feature of the village centre. Within easy reach of the village are The Roundhouse,Stone Circles and church at Stanton Drew and also the Chew Valley Lake,a centre for sailing and birdwatching.
